intro: Posidonia denhartogii, commonly known as the Denhartogii seagrass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Posidoniaceae. It is characterized by its long, ribbon-like leaves that grow underwater in shallow coastal waters. This species forms dense underwater meadows that provide critical habitat for various marine organisms. Posidonia denhartogii plays a vital role in stabilizing sediments and improving water quality in its environment. Its reproductive system involves both self-fertilization and cross-pollination, contributing to its ecological significance.
